newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: DUTCH CLOSING SHARE MARKET REPORT.
newsitem.headline: DUTCH CLOSING SHARE MARKET REPORT.

text.p: Dutch shares, sluggish after a firm start, surged in the last half hour, setting a new intraday peak moments before backing down to a new closing high.
The AEX index closed up 3.83 points, or 0.61 percent, at 627.10, just off a new intra-day peak of 627.57.
Traders said some shorts were forced to cover while others just went along with the late bullish sentiment.
After the opening, the Dutch market had spent some time in the shadow of other bourses.
Traders said profit-taking after Monday's jump of over one percent had left Dutch shares lagging.
"The market has been leaving others behind, so it was bound to have a relative off-day," one trader said.
The late rally was largely the result of strength of a individual stocks, rather than a common push.
"A couple of stocks have really raced ahead of the market," one trader said.
The heaviest trading was in Philips, which gained 3.30 guilders to 69.20. The buying came after Morgan Stanley raised its rating for the company to strong buy from outperform.
"Of course, Philips has been one of the worst performers so far this year," one trader commented.
